trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntry"></xref> objects.
This class cannot be inherited.
<xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntry> objects specify access rights for specific key containers.
Adds a <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntry"></xref> object to the collection.
The <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntry> object is added to the end of the collection.
The <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntry"></xref> object to add.
The index at which the new element was inserted.
accessEntry is `null`.
Removes all the <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntry"></xref> objects from the collection.
Use this method to empty the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntryCollection>.
Copies the elements of the collection to a compatible one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.
The one-dimensional <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntry"></xref> array that is the destination of the elements copied from the current collection.
The index in array at which copying begins.
array is `null`.
index is less than the lower bound of array.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of elements in the collection is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.
Gets the number of items in the collection.

Use the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntryCollection.Count%2A> property to determine the number of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntry> objects in the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntryCollection> collection.

The <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntryCollection.Count%2A> property is commonly used when iterating through the collection to determine the upper bound of the collection.
The number of <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntry"></xref> objects in the collection.
Returns a <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntryEnumerator"></xref> object that can be used to iterate through the objects in the collection.
Use this method to create a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntryEnumerator> object that can be used to iterate through the collection to get each item.
Use the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntryEnumerator.Current%2A> property of the enumerator to get the item currently pointed to in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntryEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> method of the enumerator to move to the next item in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntryEnumerator.Reset%2A> method of the enumerator to move to the initial position.

After you create a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntryEnumerator> object or use the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntryEnumerator.Reset%2A> method to move the enumerator to the first item in the collection, you must call the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntryEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> method.
Otherwise, the item represented by the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntryEnumerator.Current%2A> property is undefined.
A <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntryEnumerator"></xref> object that can be used to iterate through the collection.
Gets the index in the collection of the specified <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntry"></xref> object, if it exists in the collection.
Use this method to determine the index number of the specified <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntry> object in the collection.
If the specified <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntry> object is not found, an value of –1 is returned.
The <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntry"></xref> object to locate.
The index of the specified <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntry"></xref> object in the collection, or –1 if no match is found.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection is synchronized (thread safe).
This property implements the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property and always returns `false`.
`false` in all cases.
Gets the item at the specified index in the collection.

Use this indexer to get a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntry> object from the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntryCollection> at the specified index, using array notation.
The zero-based index of the element to access.
The <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntry"></xref> object at the specified index in the collection.
index is greater than or equal to the collection count.
index is negative.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntry"></xref> object from thecollection.
When you remove an item from the collection, the index values change for subsequent items in the collection.
All information about the removed item is deleted.
Use this method when you want to remove a specific item by specifying the actual item to remove.
To remove all items from the list, use the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntryCollection.Clear%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntry"></xref> object to remove.
accessEntry is `null`.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
The object returned in this implementation is the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntryCollection> object itself.

For more information on the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntryCollection.SyncRoot%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot%2A>property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
Copies the elements of the collection to a compatible one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.
The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the current collection.
The index in array at which copying begins.
array is `null`.
index is less than the lower bound of array.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of elements in the collection is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.
Returns a <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntryEnumerator"></xref> object that can be used to iterate through the objects in the collection.
A <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntryEnumerator"></xref> object that can be used to iterate through the collection.
